com.ibm.ecm.api.coresdk.model

Interface IBMECMItem

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Comparable<IBMECMBaseObject>, IBMECMBaseObject, Serializable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    IBMECMContentItem, IBMECMTeamspace

    public interface IBMECMItem
extends IBMECMBaseObject
    Represents a base item that is contained in a repository. This is typically an item that can be synced or added as a favorite.

    An IBMECMContentItem or an IBMECMTeamspace are examples of the IBMECMItem type of items.

    • Method Detail

      • isSyncEnabled

        boolean isSyncEnabled()
        Returns whether this content item is enabled for sync.
        Returns:
        true if the content item is enabled for sync

      • isFavoriteEnabled

        boolean isFavoriteEnabled()
        Returns whether this item is a favorite.
        Returns:
        true if the content item is a favorite

      • getClassId

        String getClassId()
        Returns the class id of this item. The class id is the id of the IBMECMContentClass this item is associated with.
        Returns:
        the class id of this item

      • getRepositoryId

        String getRepositoryId()
        Returns the repository id of the repository this item belongs to.
        Returns:
        the repository id of the repository this item belongs to

      • getRepository

        IBMECMRepository getRepository()
        Return a reference to the repository object that this content item belongs to.
        Returns:
        a reference to IBMECMRepository that this content item belongs to

      • addToFavorite

        void addToFavorite(String favoriteName,
                   IBMECMCompletionHandler<IBMECMFavorite> onComplete)
        Adds this item as a new favorite. Favorites are a list of items maintained in each IBM Content Navigator's desktop for quicker access.
        Parameters:
        favoriteName - the favorite name to be saved. If null, the favorite is initialized with the name of the content item.
        onComplete - the completion callback that returns the new favorite if the call is successful

      • enableSync

        void enableSync(IBMECMCompletionHandler<IBMECMSyncItem> onComplete)
        Enables sync for the current item. After sync is enabled, this item appears in a sync list and is tracked. For any registered sync clients, such as mobile devices, this content item is automatically downloaded when the sync process runs.
        Parameters:
        onComplete - the completion callback that returns the new sync item if the call is successful

      • disableSync

        void disableSync(IBMECMCompletionHandler<Boolean> onComplete)
        Disables sync for the current item. This method removes the item from the server-side list of sync items.
        Parameters:
        onComplete - the completion callback that returns true if sync was disabled

      • registerObjectForSync

        void registerObjectForSync(Integer registrationId,
                           IBMECMCompletionHandler<IBMECMSyncInfo> onComplete)
        Registers an object for syncing purposes to declare interest in receiving notification of changes to the object.
        Parameters:
        registrationId - the registration id
        onComplete - the completion callback that returns the sync info object if the call is successful

      • registerObjectForSync

        IBMECMSyncInfo registerObjectForSync(Integer registrationId)
        Registers an object for syncing purposes to declare interest in receiving notification of changes to the object.
        Parameters:
        registrationId - the registration id
        Returns:
        the sync info object if the call is successful

      • getPrivileges

        long getPrivileges()
        Returns the current user's privileges on this item. The privileges are contained in a bitmask that indicates what the current user can do.

        For more information about what each bit means, see IBMECMPrivilege.

        Returns:
        the current user's privileges in the form of a bitmask

      • hasPrivilege

        boolean hasPrivilege(IBMECMPrivilege privilege)
        Returns whether the specified privilege is granted to the current user for this item. See IBMECMPrivilege for the full set of available privileges.
        Parameters:
        privilege - the privilege bit to check
        Returns:
        true if the current user is granted this privilege for this item
